intro: Rudgea cardonae, commonly known as the cardoon plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its large, thick, and often spiny leaves that are adapted to conserve water. Its yellow flowers are typically clustered in heads and bloom in the spring. Rudgea cardonae is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
